bug.author: typhoonzero
bug.summary: Fault tolerent job default global learning rate is not set
bug.description:
Running fault tolerent job with pserver written in go currently go to this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PaddlePaddle/Paddle/blob/develop/paddle/trainer/NewRemoteParameterUpdater.cpp#L109>line</denchmark-link>
This is because the default learning rate for v2 API is always "poly": <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PaddlePaddle/Paddle/blob/develop/python/paddle/trainer_config_helpers/optimizers.py#L362>https://github.com/PaddlePaddle/Paddle/blob/develop/python/paddle/trainer_config_helpers/optimizers.py#L362</denchmark-link> , and the pserver does not support it yet. should implement "poly" method.

comments.comment: Even though we are using constant learning rate policy instead of "ploy", the model still does not converge, is it because the constant learning rate is not using the value from trainerConfig_.learning_rate() as the learning rate? And I have not see anywhere learning rate is set in that line, so I am curious what is the default value?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/helinwang>@helinwang</denchmark-link> V2 API will call <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PaddlePaddle/Paddle/blob/develop/python/paddle/trainer_config_helpers/optimizers.py#L362>https://github.com/PaddlePaddle/Paddle/blob/develop/python/paddle/trainer_config_helpers/optimizers.py#L362</denchmark-link> , the learning rate policy is "poly", and this configuration will be convert to protobuf format .
